title: Job 8:1
text: THEN answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,

title: Job 8:2
text: How long wilt thou speak these things?  and how long shall the words of thy mouth be like a strong wind?

title: Job 8:3
text: Doth God pervert judgment?  or doth the Almighty pervert justice?

title: Job 8:4
text: If thy children have sinned against him, and he have cast them away for their transgression;

title: Job 8:5
text: If thou wouldest seek unto God betimes, and make thy supplication to the Almighty;

title: Job 8:6
text: If thou wert pure and upright; surely now he would awake for thee, and make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.

title: Job 8:7
text: Though thy beginning was small, yet thy latter end should greatly increase.

title: Job 8:8
text: For enquire, I pray thee, of the former age, and prepare thyself to the search of their fathers:

title: Job 8:9
text: (For we are but of yesterday, and know nothing, because our days upon earth are a shadow:)

title: Job 8:10
text: Shall not they teach thee, and tell thee, and utter words out of their heart?

title: Job 8:11
text: Can the rush grow up without mire?  can the flag grow without water?

title: Job 8:12
text: Whilst it is yet in his greenness, and not cut down, it withereth before any other herb.

title: Job 8:13
text: So are the paths of all that forget God; and the hypocrite's hope shall perish:

title: Job 8:14
text: Whose hope shall be cut off, and whose trust shall be a spider's web.

title: Job 8:15
text: He shall lean upon his house, but it shall not stand: he shall hold it fast, but it shall not endure.

title: Job 8:16
text: He is green before the sun, and his branch shooteth forth in his garden.

title: Job 8:17
text: His roots are wrapped about the heap, and seeth the place of stones.

title: Job 8:18
text: If he destroy him from his place, then it shall deny him, saying, I have not seen thee.

title: Job 8:19
text: Behold, this is the joy of his way, and out of the earth shall others grow.

title: Job 8:20
text: Behold, God will not cast away a perfect man, neither will he help the evil doers:

title: Job 8:21
text: Till he fill thy mouth with laughing, and thy lips with rejoicing.

title: Job 8:22
text: They that hate thee shall be clothed with shame; and the dwelling place of the wicked shall come to nought.
